creation_history: Created by Andreas on December 25th, 2021. Reason: In a discussion about CI flakiness, Daniel commented [":yakcircularbuffer:"](https://discord.com/channels/830522505605283862/830739873119207426/924387598116478976), referencing the fact that circular buffers in the Kernel might be the culprit for many of these fails and crashes. In response Andreas created :yakring: and [Agni first](https://discord.com/channels/830522505605283862/830739873119207426/924401950643093544) made the [Lord of the Rings](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lord_of_the_Rings) reference replicated above.
description: *One Ring to bring them all / and in the darkness bind them* ~~(Sorry)~~. When some yak chain closes back in on itself, or just a reference to circular buffers.
remark: *One Ring to rule them all, / One Ring to find them,*
name: Yakring
